Description: Rim and body sherd of North Ionian pottery rosette bowl; pale brown clay with some silver mica; interior glazed with two added bands of thin white and red stripes; exterior: top of lip glazed; dot-rosette in frieze, with two bands below; inscribed on exterior.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIII, no. 303)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 668, no. 264)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.850)
